metadata.Title: CVE-2019-18885 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
fs/btrfs/volumes.c in the Linux kernel before 5.1 allows a btrfs_verify_dev_extents NULL pointer dereference via a crafted btrfs image because fs_devices->devices is mishandled within find_device, aka CID-09ba3bc9dd15. It was discovered that the btrfs file system in the Linux kernel did not properly validate metadata, leading to a NULL pointer dereference. An attacker could use this to specially craft a file system image that, when mounted, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18885` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1061-aws - 4.4.0-1061.65
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-azure - 4.15.0-1071.76~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-173-generic - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-lowlatency - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1

linux-image-4.4.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-173-generic - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-173-lowlatency - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-azure - 4.15.0-1071.76~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-173-generic - 4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1061.65').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1071.76~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1071.76~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-173.203~14.04.1').
